title: #[repr(align)] still marked as expermental
body:
I'm trying to compile code that uses the `crossbeam-utils` crate, which uses the `#[repr(align)]` attribute.  On nightly linux, the crate compiles fine. But on nightly windows, rustc throws an error about the attribute still being experimental.
```
error[E0658]: the struct `#[repr(align(u16))]` attribute is experimental (see is
sue #33626)
  --> C:\Users\Kyle\.cargo\registry\src\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\crossbeam-ut
ils-0.4.0\src\cache_padded.rs:19:1
   |
19 | #[repr(align(64))]
   | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = help: add #![feature(repr_align)] to the crate attributes to enable

error[E0658]: non-string literals in attributes, or string literals in top-level
 positions, are experimental (see issue #34981)
  --> C:\Users\Kyle\.cargo\registry\src\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\crossbeam-ut
ils-0.4.0\src\cache_padded.rs:19:1
   |
19 | #[repr(align(64))]
   | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = help: add #![feature(attr_literals)] to the crate attributes to enable

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors
```
I can't install rust on another windows computer because the rustup installer is broken. So I'm wondering if this is a bug with my installation or not.

### Meta
I'm using `rustc 1.28.0-nightly (1d4dbf488 2018-06-11)` on both `nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu` and `nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc`
